get.description: Retrieve a Notion user by their ID. Returns user details including name, email, and avatar.

parameters.name: start_cursor
parameters.description: If supplied, this endpoint will return a page of results starting after the cursor provided. If not supplied, this endpoint will return the first page of results.

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: The number of items from the full list desired in the response. Maximum: 100

get.description: List all users in the Notion workspace. Returns paginated list of users including bots and people.
Retrieve the bot user associated with the current API token. Useful for getting the bot's identity and owner information.

post.description: Query a Notion database with optional filters and sorts. Returns paginated list of pages (database entries) matching the criteria. Supports filtering by property values and sorting by property.

parameters.name: database_id
parameters.description: Identifier for a Notion database.

parameters.name: filter_properties
parameters.description: A list of page property value IDs associated with the database. Use this param to limit the response to a specific page property value or values for pages that meet the `filter` criteria.

filter.description: When supplied, limits which pages are returned based on the [filter conditions](ref:post-database-query-filter).

sorts.description: When supplied, orders the results based on the provided [sort criteria](ref:post-database-query-sort).

start_cursor.description: When supplied, returns a page of results starting after the cursor provided. If not supplied, this endpoint will return the first page of results.

page_size.description: The number of items from the full list desired in the response. Maximum: 100

post.description: Search for pages and databases by title across the entire Notion workspace. Returns matching pages and databases sorted by relevance or last edited time.

query.description: The text that the API compares page and database titles against.

sort.description: A set of criteria, `direction` and `timestamp` keys, that orders the results. The **only** supported timestamp value is `"last_edited_time"`. Supported `direction` values are `"ascending"` and `"descending"`. If `sort` is not provided, then the most recently edited results are returned first.

direction.description: The direction to sort. Possible values include `ascending` and `descending`.

timestamp.description: The name of the timestamp to sort against. Possible values include `last_edited_time`.

filter.description: A set of criteria, `value` and `property` keys, that limits the results to either only pages or only databases. Possible `value` values are `"page"` or `"database"`. The only supported `property` value is `"object"`.

value.description: The value of the property to filter the results by.  Possible values for object type include `page` or `database`.  **Limitation**: Currently the only filter allowed is `object` which will filter by type of object (either `page` or `database`)

property.description: The name of the property to filter by. Currently the only property you can filter by is the object type.  Possible values include `object`.   Limitation: Currently the only filter allowed is `object` which will filter by type of object (either `page` or `database`)

start_cursor.description: A `cursor` value returned in a previous response that If supplied, limits the response to results starting after the `cursor`. If not supplied, then the first page of results is returned. Refer to [pagination](https://developers.notion.com/reference/intro#pagination) for more details.

page_size.description: The number of items from the full list to include in the response. Maximum: `100`.

get.description: Retrieve the children blocks of a block or page. Returns paginated list of child blocks. Use block_id or page_id to get contents.

parameters.name: block_id
parameters.description: Identifier for a [block](ref:block)

parameters.name: start_cursor
parameters.description: If supplied, this endpoint will return a page of results starting after the cursor provided. If not supplied, this endpoint will return the first page of results.

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: The number of items from the full list desired in the response. Maximum: 100

patch.description: Append new blocks as children to a parent block or page. Supports 20+ block types including paragraphs, headings, lists, code, tables, images, and more. Use this to add content to Notion pages.

parameters.name: block_id
parameters.description: Identifier for a [block](ref:block). Also accepts a [page](ref:page) ID.

emoji.description: Emoji character for the callout icon

checked.description: Whether the to-do is checked (completed) or not

table_width.description: Number of columns in the table. Can only be set on creation.

has_column_header.description: Whether the first row is a header row

has_row_header.description: Whether the first column is a header column

children.description: Array of table_row blocks. Must have at least one row with cells matching table_width.

cells.description: Array of cells. Each cell is an array of rich text objects.
Array of cells. Each cell is an array of rich text objects. Length must match table_width.

type.description: Must be external for API-created images

url.description: Public URL to the external file

type.description: Must be external for API-created videos

url.description: Public URL to the external file

type.description: Must be external for API-created files

url.description: Public URL to the external file

name.description: Display name for the file

type.description: Must be external for API-created PDFs

url.description: Public URL to the external file
URL to embed (supports various services like YouTube, Figma, etc.)
URL to bookmark (Notion will fetch preview metadata)

children.description: Child content to append to a container block as an array of [block objects](ref:block)

after.description: The ID of the existing block that the new block should be appended after.

get.description: Retrieve a single block by its ID. Returns the block object with its type and content.

parameters.name: block_id
parameters.description: Identifier for a Notion block

patch.description: Update a block. Can modify block content (for supported types) or archive/restore blocks using the archived property.

parameters.name: block_id
parameters.description: Identifier for a Notion block

type.description: The [block object `type`](ref:block#block-object-keys) value with the properties to be updated. Currently only `text` (for supported block types) and `checked` (for `to_do` blocks) fields can be updated.

archived.description: Set to true to archive (delete) a block. Set to false to un-archive (restore) a block.

delete.description: Delete (archive) a block by its ID. The block can be restored later by setting archived to false.

parameters.name: block_id
parameters.description: Identifier for a Notion block

get.description: Retrieve a Notion page by its ID. Returns page properties, icon, cover, and metadata. Use filter_properties to limit which properties are returned.

parameters.name: page_id
parameters.description: Identifier for a Notion page

parameters.name: filter_properties
parameters.description: A list of page property value IDs associated with the page. Use this param to limit the response to a specific page property value or values. To retrieve multiple properties, specify each page property ID. For example: `?filter_properties=iAk8&filter_properties=b7dh`.

patch.description: Update page properties, icon, cover, or archive status. Supports all property types: title, rich_text, number, select, multi_select, status, date, checkbox, url, email, phone, people, relation, and files.

parameters.name: page_id
parameters.description: The identifier for the Notion page to be updated.

properties.description: The property values to update for the page. The keys are the names or IDs of the property and the values are property values. If a page property ID is not included, then it is not changed.

start.description: ISO 8601 date string (YYYY-MM-DD or with time)

end.description: Optional end date for date ranges

oneOf.description: People property value (array of user objects)
Relation property value (array of page references)
Files property value (array of external file objects)

name.description: File name

in_trash.description: Set to true to delete a block. Set to false to restore a block.

icon.description: A page icon. Supports emoji or external file URL.

cover.description: A cover image for the page. Supports external URLs or file_upload IDs.

post.description: Create a new Notion page. Must specify a parent (page_id or database_id) and properties. For database pages, properties must match the database schema.

children.description: The content to be rendered on the new page, represented as an array of [block objects](https://developers.notion.com/reference/block).

icon.description: The icon of the new page. Either an [emoji object](https://developers.notion.com/reference/emoji-object) or an [external file object](https://developers.notion.com/reference/file-object)..

cover.description: The cover image of the new page, represented as a [file object](https://developers.notion.com/reference/file-object).

post.description: Create a new database as a child of an existing page. Define the database schema with property definitions including title, text, number, select, multi_select, date, people, files, checkbox, url, email, phone, formula, relation, and rollup.

properties.description: Property schema of database. The keys are the names of properties as they appear in Notion and the values are property schema objects. To delete a property, set its value to null. To rename a property, include a 'name' field with the new name.

oneOf.description: Title property - each database must have exactly one

name.description: New name for the property (for renaming)

oneOf.description: Rich text property for multi-line text

name.description: New name for the property (for renaming)
New name for the property (for renaming)
Option name
New name for the property (for renaming)

expression.description: Formula expression using Notion formula syntax

name.description: New name for the property (for renaming)

oneOf.description: Relation property linking to another database

type.description: Relation type - single_property creates one-way, dual_property creates two-way relation

single_property.description: Empty object for single property relation

synced_property_name.description: Name of the corresponding property in the related database

synced_property_id.description: ID of the corresponding property in the related database

name.description: New name for the property (for renaming)

oneOf.description: Rollup property for aggregating relation data

relation_property_name.description: Name of the relation property to roll up

relation_property_id.description: ID of the relation property to roll up

rollup_property_name.description: Name of the property to aggregate in the related database

rollup_property_id.description: ID of the property to aggregate in the related database

name.description: New name for the property (for renaming)
New name for the property (for renaming)
New name for the property (for renaming)

New name for the property (for renaming)

oneOf.description: Set to null to delete a property

patch.description: Update a database title, description, or property schema. Can add new properties, rename existing ones, or delete properties by setting them to null.

parameters.name: database_id
parameters.description: identifier for a Notion database

title.description: An array of [rich text objects](https://developers.notion.com/reference/rich-text) that represents the title of the database that is displayed in the Notion UI. If omitted, then the database title remains unchanged.

description.description: An array of [rich text objects](https://developers.notion.com/reference/rich-text) that represents the description of the database that is displayed in the Notion UI. If omitted, then the database description remains unchanged.

properties.description: Property schema of database. The keys are the names of properties as they appear in Notion and the values are property schema objects. To delete a property, set its value to null. To rename a property, include a 'name' field with the new name.

oneOf.description: Title property - each database must have exactly one

name.description: New name for the property (for renaming)

get.description: Retrieve a database by its ID. Returns the database schema including all property definitions, title, and description.

parameters.name: database_id
parameters.description: An identifier for the Notion database.

get.description: Retrieve a specific property value from a page. Useful for paginated properties like rich_text, title, relation, and rollup. Returns the property item(s).

parameters.name: page_id
parameters.description: Identifier for a Notion page

parameters.name: property_id
parameters.description: Identifier for a page [property](https://developers.notion.com/reference/page#all-property-values)

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: For paginated properties. The max number of property item objects on a page. The default size is 100

parameters.name: start_cursor
parameters.description: For paginated properties.

get.description: Retrieve comments on a block or page. Returns paginated list of discussion comments.

parameters.name: block_id
parameters.description: Identifier for a Notion block or page

parameters.name: start_cursor
parameters.description: If supplied, this endpoint will return a page of results starting after the cursor provided. If not supplied, this endpoint will return the first page of results.

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: The number of items from the full list desired in the response. Maximum: 100

post.description: Create a new comment on a page. Comments are added to the page discussion thread.

parent.description: The page that contains the comment

post.description: Initiates a file upload. Returns a File Upload object with upload_url for sending file contents. Upload must be completed within 1 hour.

filename.description: Optional filename (max 900 bytes). Extension auto-detected from content_type if not specified.

content_type.description: MIME type of the file (e.g., image/png, application/pdf)

mode.description: Upload mode. Use multi_part for files > 20MB (up to 5GB in paid workspaces).

number_of_parts.description: Required for multi_part mode. Number of parts the file will be split into.

post.description: Upload file contents to Notion. Use multipart/form-data with file field. For multi-part uploads, include part_number.

parameters.name: file_upload_id
parameters.description: The file upload ID from create-file-upload

part_number.description: Required for multi_part mode. The part number being uploaded.

post.description: Finalize a multi-part file upload after all parts have been sent.

parameters.name: file_upload_id
parameters.description: The file upload ID

get.description: Retrieve a file upload object to check its status.

parameters.name: file_upload_id
parameters.description: The file upload ID
